title: What are the key Asset Types?
description: Uncover how businesses classify their valuable resources and holdings.

words.fact: Current Assets: Resources expected to be converted to cash or used within one year. Examples include cash, accounts receivable, inventory, and short-term investments.
Fixed Assets: Long-term tangible property used in operations. Examples include buildings, equipment, vehicles, and land. Also called Property, Plant, and Equipment (PP&E).
Intangible Assets: Non-physical assets with value. Examples include patents, trademarks, copyrights, goodwill, brand recognition, and intellectual property.
Liquid Assets: Assets that can be quickly converted to cash with minimal loss of value. The most liquid assets include cash, money market funds, and marketable securities.
